titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 21: a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 21
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Friday October 21, 1825 session of court, in which three criminal cases were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Friday 21st.
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment, Present their Honors John Martin &C Jurors, G Saunders, Fore

Archy Foreman Ptf
vs
Michael Huffacre Dft
Judgement confessed $10_00 with the costs of suit $4_50

Cherokee Nation Ptf
vs
Gahcowe Dft

Indictment for Murder of Ezekiel Walkingsticks brother, We the Judges of the Supreme Court, find no bill against the Dft Gahcowe, Given from, under my hand at New Town this 21st of October 1825 JMartin, C,S,C

Jessee Bushy Head Ptf
vs
Samuel Henry Dft
For breaking the Cherokee by selling spiritous liquors It is the opinion of the jury that Samuel Henry has violated the Cherokee law & be fined $100 George Saunders, Foreman.
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock.
